title: PHPmax()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPmax()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Find highest value with the max() function: "); echo(max(22,14,68,18,15) . "
"); echo(max(array(4,6,8,10)) . "
"); echo(max(array(44,16,81,12))); ?> Definition and Usage The max() function returns the highest value in an array, or the highest value of several specified values. Syntax max( array_values ); or max( value1,value2,... ); Parameter Values Parameter Description array_values Required. Specifies an array containing the values value1,value2,... Required. Specifies the values to compare (must be at least two values) Technical Details Return Value: The numerically highest value Return Type: Mixed PHP Version: 4+ ★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPmax()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPmax()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
